entry.title: Economic activity in Armenia increased by 9.6%

media:group.media:title: Economic activity in Armenia increased by 9.6%
media:group.media:description:
üëâEconomic activity in Armenia rose by 9.6% between January and March of 2022, compared to the same period last year. The data comes from the Statistical Committee of Armenia.
üëâNo document regarding the status of Nagorno-Karabakh is being discussed at this stage, says President of Nagorno-Karabakh Arayik Harutyunyan.
üëâThe relatives of some of the victims of the Second Karabakh War have demanded to file a lawsuit against Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan.

entry.title: Tech giant NVIDIA opens research center in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Tech giant NVIDIA opens research center in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
NVIDIA is one of the world‚Äôs leading tech giants, with over 20,000 employees worldwide. The California based company, which has managed to create $27 billion in revenue, recently opened an office in Armenia. Rev Lebaredian, the Vice President of Omniverse and Simulation Technology at NVIDIA, talks to CivilNet‚Äôs Emilio Cricchio about the decision to open an office in Armenia, what made Armenia an attractive destination, and what he thinks about the potential of the Armenian IT sector.

entry.title: Armenia‚Äôs opposition deputies announce daily protests, begin march to Yerevan

media:group.media:title: Armenia‚Äôs opposition deputies announce daily protests, begin march to Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
üìçA number of opposition lawmakers from Armenia‚Äôs parliament began a march from Tavush region to Yerevan, calling on Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan to resign. üìçForeign Minister Ararat Mirzoyan met in person with his Indian counterpart, Subramanyam Jaishankar, and held a phone call with his Azerbaijani counterpart, Jeyhun Bayramov. üìçThere are now about 12,000 ethnic Armenian soldiers and 1,600 Russian peacekeepers stationed in Karabakh, according to a new briefing from the International Crisis Group. üìçHundreds of thousands of people commemorated Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day over the weekend in Armenia and around the world.

entry.title: The Armenian Genocide amd the enduring struggle for justice and human rights

media:group.media:title: The Armenian Genocide amd the enduring struggle for justice and human rights
media:group.media:description:
In a special edition of #Frontlines, Karnig Kerkonian and Garo Ghazarian talk to Taner Akcam , a world-renowned Armenian Genocide scholar and the inaugural Director of the Armenian Genocide Research Program at UCLA Ak√ßam discusses the Armenian Genocide and its crucial and enduring legacy in the struggle for the advancement of human rights and global justice.

media:group.media:title: 2022 Aurora Humanitarians Announced in Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
On April 24, 2022, on the Armenian Genocide Remembrance Day, the Aurora Humanitarian Initiative announces the names of 2022 Aurora Humanitarians, chosen for their exceptional impact, courage, and commitment to putting themselves at risk to help others.
